hanzi-su-wiki:
測

Значения

Измерять, вычислять; рассматривать, предполагать

Мнемоника

Не зная броду, не суйся в воду 氵. Основное правило 則 для воды — измерь её глубину.

Варианты

测

cè
to survey; to measure; to conjecture
делать обзор; измерять; предполагать

heisig_keyword: fathom | измерять глубину воды фатомами, планировать
heisig_chinese_memo: A fathom is the unit you use when making rules about water's depth.
heisig_constituent: fathom, water, water droplets, water pistol, rule, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight, sword, sabre, saber
heisig_story: Connoting the measurement of the depth of water, the keyword fathom begins with the water primitive. To its right, we see the compound-primitive for rule (Frame 92) which we learned in the sense of a "ruler" or "measure." Hence, when we rule water we fathom it. What could be simpler? But be careful; its simplicity is deceptive. Be sure to picture yourself fathoming a body of water several hundred feet deep by using a ruler of gargantuan proportions.
koohiiStory1: A fathom is the unit you use when making rules about water´s depth.
koohiiStory2: You can´t fathom how deep this water is. Perhaps you should use a ruler to measure it?
jp_example_words:
推測(すいそく): guess, conjecture
測る(はかる): to measure, to weigh, to survey, to time (sound gauge estimate)
観測(かんそく): observation
測定(そくてい): measurement
測量(そくりょう): measurement, surveying
予測(よそく): prediction, estimation
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tsunami will pick up a bunch of shellfish and dump them on your shore, so you take a knife and measure them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You can't eat shellfish that are too small, so you place your knife along them to measure them. If they're big enough, you stick the knife in and eat them raw.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: All of the shellfish you measure that are too small go into your sock (そく). Once the sock is full, you swing it around you head and lob it back into the ocean.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: If you measure one of these shellfish and it's too small, stuff it right into your sock. Then once the sock measures about 12 shellfish long, toss it back to sea!
Ru_Words:

  • предположение, догадка (о мотивах, причинах и т.п.)
    • 観測かんそく
  • наблюдение; заключение (на основании наблюдений)
    • 計測けいそく
  • измерение
    • 予測よそく
  • прогноз, предположение
    • 不測ふそく
  • непредвиденное, нерасчётное

Ru_trainchinese:

cè: (графема) предполагать, заключать, догадываться
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the rule (則) of the water (氵) can be measured
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: It's hard to fathom a shellfish with a sword roaming around the ocean water.
humanum_full_description_en:
Bronze inscription starts with " water " and " then " sound, which means extreme and exhaustion, and often means measurement afterwards. Shang Zeng Da Zi Ding: "To use filial piety and to use you, it is in harmony with non-test." "Wu-test" means endless, meaning that there is no end to the harmony of alcohol and food to sacrifice to parents (Samson Jingming, etc.). "Shu Wen": "Survey, the depth is also. From the water, the sound." "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧Da Situ": "Measure the depth of the soil by the method of soil and guru." Zheng Xuan's note: "Measure, stillness ."

" Test " can mean guess. "Book of Rites-Shaoyi": "No test is not reached." Zheng Xuan's note: "Testing, meaning degree."

" Measure " also means the depth of water. "Erya Interpretation": "Deep diving, measure also." Guo Pu's note: "Measure, also an alias for water depth."
humanum_short_description_en: Bronze inscription starts with the sound of " water " and " then ", which means extreme and exhaustion, and often means measurement afterwards.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「水」，「則」聲，表示極、盡，後常表示測量。上曾大子鼎：「用孝用亯，既龢無測。」「無測」即無盡之意，表示調和祭祀父母的酒食無有休止（參孫敬明等）。《說文》：「測，深所至也。从水則聲。」《周禮‧地官‧大司徒》：「以土圭之法，測土深。」鄭玄注：「測，猶度也。」

　　「測」可表示猜度。《禮記‧少儀》：「毋測未至。」鄭玄注：「測，意度也。」

　　「測」還表示水的深度。《爾雅‧釋言》：「潛深，測也。」郭璞注：「測，亦水深之別名。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「水」，「則」聲，表示極、盡，後常表示測量。

金文從「 水 」，「 則 」聲，表示極、盡，後常表示測量。上曾大子鼎：「用孝用亯，既龢無測。」「無測」即無盡之意，表示調和祭祀父母的酒食無有休止（參孫敬明等）。《說文》：「測，深所至也。从水則聲。」《周禮‧地官‧大司徒》：「以土圭之法，測土深。」鄭玄注：「測，猶度也。」 「 測 」可表示猜度。《禮記‧少儀》：「毋測未至。」鄭玄注：「測，意度也。」 「 測 」還表示水的深度。《爾雅‧釋言》：「潛深，測也。」郭璞注：「測，亦水深之別名。」
Bronze inscription starts with " water" and " then" sound, which means extreme and exhaustion, and often means measurement afterwards. Shang Zeng Da Zi Ding: "To use filial piety and to use you, it is in harmony with non-test." "Wu-test" means endless, meaning that there is no end to the harmony of alcohol and food to sacrifice to parents (Samson Jingming, etc.). "Shu Wen": "Survey, the depth is also. From the water, the sound." "Zhou Li‧Diguan‧Da Situ": "Measure the depth of the soil by the method of soil and guru." Zheng Xuan's note: "Measure, stillness ." " Test" can mean guess. "Book of Rites-Shaoyi": "No test is not reached." Zheng Xuan's note: "Testing, meaning degree." " Measure" also means the depth of water. "Erya Interpretation": "Deep diving, measure also." Guo Pu's note: "Measure, also an alias for water depth."

測字的基本解释

測
cè
见“测”。

測字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cè］
［《廣韻》初力切，入職，初。］
“测1”的繁体字。
(1)量度；测量。
(2)猜度。
(3)知。
(4)尽，极。
(5)探访。
(6)水的深度。
(7)泛指深。参见“測恩”。
(8)刑具名。
(9)指使用测刑。
(10)清。
(11)见“測測”。
(12)通“側”。隐伏。

測字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　測； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页635第01
【唐韻】初側切【集韻】【韻會】察色切【正韻】初力切，?音惻。【說文】深所至也。【玉篇】度深曰測。　又凡測度之稱。【易·繫辭】隂陽不測之謂神。　又淸也。【周禮·冬官考工記】弓人漆欲測。　又測測，刃利意。【詩·周頌·畟畟良耜傳】畟畟，猶測測。

Measurement
Name meaning

cè
вм. 测
Radicals: 氵, 貝, 刂  (tsunami, shellfish, knife)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tsunami will pick up a bunch of shellfish and dump them on your shore, so you take a knife and measure them.
You can't eat shellfish that are too small, so you place your knife along them to measure them. If they're big enough, you stick the knife in and eat them raw.
Reading Mnemonic
All of the shellfish you measure that are too small go into your sock (そく). Once the sock is full, you swing it around you head and lob it back into the ocean.
If you measure one of these shellfish and it's too small, stuff it right into your sock. Then once the sock measures about 12 shellfish long, toss it back to sea!
